channel.title: I'm looking for some help!

item.title: I'm looking for some help!
item.dc:creator: @darkness101 darkness101
item.description:
@darkness101 wrote:

You need to get the model ID thing and put it in the model folders in your client, or It won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm looking for some help!
item.dc:creator: @Abcscape Abcscape
item.description:
@Abcscape wrote:

[center][size=13pt]This was all done in class8.java.[/size][/center]

I’m looking for some help. I’ve downloaded a client recently. It’s got no added items at all. I need to add some items from scratch.

if(i == 14073) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[3]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 810; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 912; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 22464; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 912; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 67080; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 912; class8.anInt174 = 4151; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 720; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 0; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 0; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 0; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 4202;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 4204;//female wearing class8.aString170 = "Attack hood"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Its a attack hood".getBytes(); }

I added this code in class8.java. I then searched for.

anIntArray195 = new int[anInt203];

I replace that with.

anIntArray195 = new int[anInt203+40000];

It compiled. I then spawned the item but it showed up as this.

I then spawned it with the exact same code on a different client, it worked.

[center][size=13pt]I need help bad. If it’s possible for you to help, please do so.[/size][/center]

Read full topic
